data.name: Preface
entries: The Northern Reaches Survival Guide is a collection of wintery content. Its authors can be found in the Fungalbrewery Discord Server, who are happy to take feedback and love to hear stories about how you used our content.

The contents of this collection are intended to be balanced for play in a typical group that plays the 5th edition of Dungeons & Dragons. For egregious balance issues, concerns, praise, or feedback, please contact the authors through server or direct message to fungusamongus. or /u/Fungalbrews.

data.name: Chapter 1: Subclasses
entries: This section presents four new subclasses to compliment those in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}. These new options are available to you when you create a character or when your character reaches the appropriate level, provided your DM allows you to use them in your campaign.

entries.name: Divine Domains
entries: At 1st level, a cleric gains the Divine Domain feature. The following additional options are available to a cleric: {@class Cleric|PHB|Shelter Domain|Shelter|NorthernReaches} and {@class Cleric|PHB|Winter Domain|Winter|NorthernReaches}.

entries.name: Druid Circle
entries: At 2nd level, a druid gains the Druid Circle feature. The following additional option is available to a druid: the {@class Druid|PHB|Circle of Mountaintop|Mountaintop|NorthernReaches}.

entries.name: Fighter Maneuver Option
entries: If you have access to maneuvers, the following maneuver is added to the list of options available to you. Maneuvers are available to {@class Fighter|PHB|Battle Masters|Battle Master}, but also to characters who have a special feature like the Superior Technique fighting style or the Martial Adept feat.

entries.name: Roguish Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, a rogue gains the Roguish Archetype feature. The following additional option is available to a rogue: the {@class Rogue|PHB|Cryosleeper|Cryosleeper|NorthernReaches}.

entries.name: Eldritch Invocations
entries: At 2nd level, a warlock gains the Eldritch Invocations feature. Here are new options for that feature, in addition to the options in the Player's Handbook

If an eldritch invocation has a prerequisite, you must meet it to learn the invocation. You can learn the invocation at the same time that you meet its prerequisite. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

entries.caption: Eldritch Invocations
rows: {@spell hex|PHB} spell or a warlock feature that curses

data.name: Chapter 3: Spells
entries: This section presents new spells to supplement those in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}. These new spells allow your character to harness a variety of magics related to temperature and cold weather. Your DM might allow access to these spells at character creation, or your party might discover them frozen in ice or locked away in mountaintop ruins.

data.name: Chapter 4: Magic Items
entries: This chapter offers new magic items to supplement those in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} and {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}. These new items allow your character to harness the power of freezing winter and the blasting wind.
Your DM determines if and where these items they might be discovered, whether they be frozen in icebergs, buried beneath or eternal snow, or enshrined on the highest mountain peaks.
The following magic items are presented in alphabetical order.

data.name: Chapter 5: Bestiary
entries: This chapter presents new monsters to supplement those in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}. Most of these monsters fit well in wilderness campaigns, though many of them could find their place in a wide variety of environments.

As with the monsters in the Monster Manual, most creatures should have lore general enough to fit into most settings. Though each creature has lore presented, the monsters' behaviors and attitudes can be changed however necessary to fit your setting.
The monsters are presented in alphabetical order.
The monsters are presented in alphabetical order.

data.name: Chapter 6: Miscellaneous Creatures
entries: This section contains statistics for various animals, vermin, and other nonmagical critters. The stat blocks are organized alphabetically by creature name.
You can make any existing creature, such as a rabbit, a fox, or an owl into an arctic variant by adding the following features.

entries.name: Subarctic Adaptation
entries: If the creature is not already proficient in Stealth, then it can add its proficiency bonus to any Dexterity (Stealth) check it makes to attempt to hide in snowy conditions. It is also naturally adapted to extreme cold, and requires half as much food as it ordinarily would to survive.
Many beasts with this feature, though not all, are colored off-white rather than the colors found in colder climes.

subclassFeature.name: Shelter Domain
entries: The gods of shelter include not only the gods who protect their followers in the wilderness, but also the gods of safety, comfort, and the home who bring stability and familial love to their followers.

Gods of of the home include Hestia, Cyrrollalee, and Luthic, and gods of survival and the hunt include Semanya, Solonor Thelandira, and Artemis. Most importantly, household deities who protect individual families also fall under this domain, alongside helpful nature spirits who guide lost travelers to pockets of safety.

entries.caption: Shelter Domain Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water}, {@spell Leomund's tiny hut}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in either {@item cook's utensils|phb}, {@item carpenter's tools|phb}, Survival, or one {@item musical instrument|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Protection from the Elements
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the ability to shield yourself and others from harm.

When you and at least one other creature are affected by an area of effect (such as the fireball spell or a green dragon's breath weapon) that allows a target to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to create a sphere of safety centered on yourself.
This sphere has a radius in feet equal to 5 * your proficiency bonus. Creatures and objects within the sphere take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rest Easy
entries: At 2nd level, you can ward the sleep of yourself and your allies from danger. When you begin a short or long rest, you can use your Channel Divinity to create an invisible, 15-foot-radius sphere at a point you touch that lasts until the end of the rest or you leave the sphere.

Creatures within the sphere cannot be perceived through magical scrying sensors, and do not need to make saving throws against effects that force a save at the end of a rest, such as mummy rot. If you ward a rest with this feature, you do not regain a use of your Channel Divinity after the rest ends.

subclassFeature.name: Comfort Zone
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can center your Protection From the Elements feature on any creature within 90 feet of you that you can see, and do not need to be a target of the triggering area of effect to use it.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Safety First
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can conduct a 10-minute ritual that opens your eyes to dangers around you. You are aware of the following within 500 feet of yourself, which appear outlined in dim light visible only to you:

items: Ledges, edges, pitfalls, dropoffs, and areas of unstable ground.
Creatures that are hostile to you, or would become hostile to you when they become aware of your presence.

entries: You remain aware of the location and position of the detected creatures and objects for the next hour. If you do not have a direct line of sight to a detected creature or object, you see its outline in dim light through all obstacles that appear between you and it.
After you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Winter Domain
entries: The gods of winter rule snow-capped mountain peaks, arctic tundras, harsh glaciers, and the long, dark months when ice and cold advance from the north. Often feared, many are associated with biting winds, frigid storms, darkness, and death.

For some, however, winter is a time of rebirth and comfort, ringing in the new year. Snow and ice melt into much-needed water come spring, and religious ceremonies and festivities mark the cold months as people huddle together around a fire.

Followers of the gods of winter often walk a tightrope between destruction and renewal; some gods like Thrym, Auril, Itzlacolihqui, and Poli'Ahu threaten civilization with howling blizzards and deep freezes, while others like Rellavar Danuvien, Ullr, and Skadi take advantage of ice and snow to hunt and entertain in the winter.
The winter domain also encompasses gods that personify winter as a force of nature, and include Kuraokami, Boreas, Gohone, Calleach Bheur, and Himavat.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the {@spell ray of frost} cantrip if you don't already know it. This cantrip doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know, and is considered a cleric cantrip for you.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Runs Cold
entries: Also at 1st level, you fill your offense with the terrible chill of winter. Once per turn when you deal cold damage to a creature without resistance or immunity to cold damage, you can {@condition deafened||deafen} the target, {@condition frightened||frighten} it, or inflict the first level of {@condition exhaustion||exhaustion} upon it. If the target is already suffering from one or more levels of exhaustion, you cannot inflict an additional level.

If you dealt cold damage to more than one creature with the same effect, choose one of the targets to suffer your chosen condition. Regardless of which condition you chose, the effect lasts until the end of your target's next turn.
The damage you use to inflict these conditions must originate from one of the following:

items: A {@filter cleric spell|spells|class=cleric|subclass=cleric: winter (nrsg)|damage type=cold} you cast.
An attack you make with a magic weapon that deals cold damage.
A creature you summon with a {@filter cleric spell|spells|class=cleric|subclass=cleric: winter (northernreaches)|components & miscellaneous=smn;!reprinted} or magical item.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: White Walker
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can conduct a 10-minute ritual and expend a use of your chanel divinity to shroud yourself in the silence of newfallen snow. For the next hour, you and up to 10 creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you add half your Wisdom score to Wisdom (Perception) and Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Chilled to the Bone
entries: Starting at 6th level, the dread of an oncoming winter echoes through your spells.

Creatures you {@condition frightened} move at half their normal speed until the effect ends. In addition, you can inflict up to the third level of exhaustion with your Blood Runs Cold feature, rather than the first, and can choose to blind the target instead of choosing one of the other options.
Finally, cold damage you deal ignores resistance and immunity to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Sculpture of Snow
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can create lifelike imitations of reality from nothing more than snow and ice. You can cast {@spell creation} without material components, and must complete a short rest before you do so again. Similarly, you can cast {@spell simulacrum} without material components, and must complete a long rest before you do so again.
These spells are considered cleric spells for you, and do not count against the number of cleric spells you have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Mountaintop
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Mountaintop are the undisputed masters of the cold, snowy skies. Stalwart defenders of frigid conclaves hewed from the soaring cliffs they call home, these stern practitioners of ancient magic live in wary harmony with surroundings that punish the slightest mistake with frigid doom.

The friends of monastic temples, fur-coated barbarians, and the goliath tribes who share their snowy peaks, these druids shape and reshape their environment with potent manipulation of wind and stone alike. When battles between heroes and monsters shatter precipices into avalanches, these druids stand ready to remind trespassers why it is no easy feat to climb a mountain.

subclassFeature.name: Cliffside Native
entries: At 2nd level, you become accustomed to life at the roof of the world. You're acclimated to environments at high altitudes, including those above 10,000 feet. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, which you also possess whenever you use your Wild Shape feature or are otherwise transformed, even if your current form doesn't ordinarily have a climb speed. In addition, you ignore difficult terrain created by ice, snow, and slush, and can safely walk on nonmagical ice of any thickness, which doesn't break under your weight.
While in your Wild Shape, you can choose to deal cold damage, instead of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, whenever you land an attack with your beast form's natural weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Windward
entries: Also at 2nd level, you learn the {@spell gust|XGE} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of druid cantrips you know. When you cast a druid spell that creates or manipulates wind, roll {@dice 1d6}.

You can increase the spell's area (if it has one) in all dimensions by a number of feet equal to the result times five. If the spell moves a creature other than you, then the distance it moves is multiplied by the result.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Mountains
entries: Starting at 6th level, the frigid air of snowcapped peaks emanates from your attacks and spells.

Whenever you deal cold damage, you can create an icy fog in a 10-foot radius around one of the targets you damaged. This fog remains in place after the target moves. It disperses at the end of your next turn or until a wind of moderate or greater speed blows it away. Winds that you create do not disperse the fog.
The area inside the fog is heavily obscured, but you and any other creatures you choose can see through it.

You can create this fog a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest. If you finish a short rest while above 10,000 feet, you regain all expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Leeward
entries: At 10th level, when you cast any druid spell with the word {@filter wall|spells|class=druid|area style=w} in its name, roll {@dice 1d4}. You can expand the area of that spell's effect in all dimensions by a number of feet equal to the result times five, provided you didn't already expand it with your Windward feature.

subclassFeature.name: Barrier Peaks
entries: By 14th level, you stand high above the rest of the world, unfazed by the frozen air of the mountain.
Any cold damage you deal ignores resistance and immunity to cold damage.

You can rise to the top of a {@filter wall spell|spells|class=druid|area style=w} whenever you cast one, so long as you include your space within its target area and its dimensions are no smaller than the space you occupy. You are also immune to the effects of wall spells you cast and can climb them, stand upon them, and walk through them, even if the walls would not ordinarily be able to hold a creature up or let a creature pass through.

subclassFeature.name: Cryosleeper
entries: The process by which Cryosleepers acquire their unsettling and powerful abilities is a mystery. Some believe a secret society creates a hidden army of assassins, preserved in ice to allow their bodies to absorb icy magic over the course of decades. Others believe they are undead returned from a wintry grave to revenge themselves upon those who wronged them life.
Regardless of your origins, you are frozen to the depths of your very soul.

subclassFeature.name: Bone-Chilling Grasp
entries: When you take this archetype at 3rd level, you learn how to channel terrifying cold to freeze your enemies in place.

As a bonus action, you can reach out and touch a creature, which must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, you drain it of warmth and ice spreads across its body.
The target is {@condition restrained} until the start of its next turn or until it takes fire damage. Creatures with the Heated Body trait and similar features are immune to this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Winter Wake
entries: Also at 3rd level, your mind and body no longer need the relief of natural rest. Magic cannot put you to sleep.

When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Silence of Snowfall
entries: When you reach 9th level, you conjure gentle winds of soft snow from within yourself to soften your tread, lest you disturb the rest of others.

others. You leave no footprints in snow, gain resistance to falling damage, and can cast the {@spell silence} spell centered on yourself a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell. When you cast silence in this way, it moves with you, and you cannot be detected by {@sense tremorsense|mm}. You regain all uses of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sleepwalker
entries: At 13th level, the cold within you numbs you to pain and debilitation. When you are {@condition incapacitated}, you can still take actions and reactions.

In addition, when you are {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition unconscious}, you can still move at half your normal movement speed and make Strength and Dexterity saving throws, albeit with disadvantage.

You are also aware of your surroundings when {@condition petrified} or {@condition unconscious} (though you still cannot speak or communicate in any intelligible way), and ignore the effects of the first three levels of {@condition exhaustion} if you are suffering them.

subclassFeature.name: Forced Hibernation
entries: Forced Hibernation When you reach 17th level, your frigid energy is able to penetrate far more than just your target's body. When you use your Bone-Chilling Grasp bonus action, you can choose to forgo its normal effects and instead force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw against the same DC. On a failure, a blanket of relentless cold knocks the target {@condition unconscious} for the next minute. If the target takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake, it wakes early.

On a success, the target is shaken by the experience, and has disadvantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws until the start of its next turn. Creatures immune to being {@condition frightened} have advantage on this saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Catch
entries: If you take the Attack action while airborne, you can forgo one of your attacks and expend a superiority die to make one melee weapon attack against a vertical or near-vertical surface (such as a wall or cliff) within your reach.

You add the superiority die to the attack roll. If it equals or exceeds the material's Armor Class (as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide) you embed the weapon in the surface, fall 10 more feet, and stop.
You can also perform this maneuver as a reaction while falling.
If you hit the ground before you fall 10 more feet, any falling damage you take is halved. If you keep at least one free hand on the weapon and do not attack with it again, you cannot fall.

Additionally, if a creature falls within your reach, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to attempt to catch it. If you are not standing on the ground, the creature stops falling and takes no damage.
If you are on the ground, roll the superiority die and subtract the result from the number of falling damage dice the creature rolls by the result.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Hex
entries: When you curse a creature and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can instill a sense of impending doom in a target cursed by your {@spell hex} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. The target cannot move closer to you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Coolheaded
entries: You are immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions, and have advantage on checks and saving throws to avoid being possessed or magically put to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Freeze Tag
entries: You can use your action to touch a creature within reach, making a melee spell attack against an unwilling creature. If you successfully touch the creature, it freezes in place and is {@condition petrified} until you stop touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Guidance of the Talisman
entries: While wearing your talisman, you can conduct a 10-minute ritual to beseech your patron for aid when lost. The talisman glows faintly for the next 8 hours (or until you end the effect as a bonus action), shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. The light points toward the nearest place your patron would deem a safe shelter for you. If the talisman is moved more than 10 feet away from you during this time, it magically reappears in your hand at the start of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Naughty or Nice
entries: The names and alignments of all creatures within 30 feet of you that are not behind total cover appear in your Book of Shadows, fading 1 hour after a creature moves out of range. The entry also lists which material possession or type of object the named creature desires most.

optionalfeature.name: Snowpiercer
entries: You can use a bonus action to touch your pact weapon to an area of difficult terrain and clear it in a line 5 feet wide and 60 feet long in a direction you choose.

optionalfeature.name: Wild Beast's Cage
entries: You can cast {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere} at will, targeting a beast, dragon, or monstrosity, without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this invocation on a creature, you must complete a long rest before you use it on that creature again.

item.name: Ice Skates
entries: You can take 1 minute to attach this pair of sharp metal blades to the bottoms of your footwear. While wearing them, your walking speed is reduced to 10 feet unless you are standing on ice. While standing on ice, you can move at your normal speed and do not need to make checks or saving throws to remain upright or move about on the ice unless acted on by another creature, object, or effect.

item.name: Portable Stove
entries: This small, flat-bottomed iron pot is enclosed by a removable iron grate. Handles on each side make it easy to carry, and the wide base allows it to store ample wood or coal. Fuel in this stove can burn even in cold, wet conditions.

item.name: Skis
entries: You can take 1 minute to attach this pair of long strips of hardened wood to the bottoms of your footwear. While wearing them, your speed is reduced to 10 feet unless you are standing on snow. While standing on snow, you can move up to twice your normal speed and do not need to make checks or saving throws to remain upright or move on the snow unless acted on by another creature, object, or effect.

item.name: Snow Goggles
entries: These goggles, traditionally made from driftwood, bone, or ivory, are carved to fit close to the face and feature two thin horizontal slits to minimize incoming light and glare. While wearing these goggles, you do not have to make saves against blindness or damage to the eyes from light reflected off snow or ice.

item.name: Snowshoes
entries: You can take 1 minute to attach this pair of oblong wooden lattices to the bottoms of your footwear. While wearing them, your walking speed is not reduced by moving through thick snow, and you walk along the surface of snowdrifts and deep snow rather than sinking into it.

item.name: Bag of Gifts
entries: Inside this heavy cloth sack are {@dice 3d4} small boxes wrapped in bright, colorful paper and tied with ribbons. The bag weighs 1 pounds plus ¼ pound for every gift it contains.

You can use an action to dump the bag's contents on the ground or remove one gift from the big and give it to another creature (or keep it for yourself). Neither divination magic nor magical sensors can perceive the contents of a gift before its recipient opens it.

If a non-evil creature opens a gift, it receives an item. The DM can choose a gift from the table below, determine it randomly, or create an effect. If an evil creature opens a gift, it instead receives a chunk of coal or charcoal that weighs ¼ pound.

Regardless of its contents, the packaging disappears after a creature opens a gift, which is bonded to the recipient unless it willingly gives it to another creature, which becomes the new recipient. (magical or nonmagical coercion is not considered a willing transfer of ownership).
The recipient of the gift can use an action to teleport the gift into its empty hand, provided the two are on the same plane.
Once all gifts have been distributed, the bag remains empty until the next winter solstice, when it refills with {@dice 3d4} small boxes.

entries.caption: Bag of Gifts
rows: A wooden toy carved with a smooth finish and painted with bright colors
A {@item musical instrument|PHB} made by expert craftsmen with quality materials
A {@filter saddle|items|miscellaneous=mundane;!reprinted|search=saddle} made of fine, exotic leather with buckles made of precious metals
A {@filter simple or martial nonmagical weapon|items|type=simple weapon;martial weapon|miscellaneous=mundane} made of quality materials that never dulls
A set of {@filter artisan's tools|items|type=artisan's tools;!treasure (gemstone);!treasure (art object);!renaissance;!treasure (coinage);!modern;!futuristic}, made with high-quality components
A set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, tailored perfectly to the recipient's measurements and personal tastes
A {@table 10 gp gemstones|dmg|gemstone} worth 10 gp, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide
An {@table 25 gp Art Objects|dmg|art object} worth 25 gp, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide

A {@item spell scroll (cantrip)|dmg|spell scroll} that contains 1 cantrip of the DM's choosing. The recipient can cast this scroll even if the cantrip does not appear on its spell list or if it is not ordinarily capable of casting a spell

A collar light and small enough to fit any {@filter Tiny beast|bestiary|type=beast|size=t}. If a beast attunes to this collar, a spellcaster can use it as the material component of the find familiar spell, which allows the caster to summon and resurrect the beast, so long as it did not die of natural causes. The collar is not consumed when used as a component
A {@filter common magical item|items|source=dmg;xge|rarity=common|miscellaneous=!mundane;!reprinted}, as described in Xanathar's Guide to Everything

item.name: Bone Picks
entries: This sickle made from carved whalebone and mammoth ivory can be split into two sickles with the object interaction you receive as part of your turn. If you finish a long rest while the two sickles are separated, the one furthest from you teleports to the one closest to you and the two combine.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

If you are wielding both sickles, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and automatically succeed on checks you make to climb slick vertical surfaces (such as ice) or when you make a check as part of the {@action Climb onto a Bigger Creature|dmg} variant action.

item.name: Cloak of Insulation
entries: The leathery skin of lesser demons composes this warm flesh-colored cape fringed with coarse black fur. While you wear it, you have resistance to cold, fire, and lightning damage.

item.name: Hail of Arrows
entries: Walrus leather encircles the grip of this delicate whalebone bow, which is always cold to the touch. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic bow, a target takes an extra 1d8 cold damage when you hit it.
The bow has 7 charges, and regains 1d6 + 1 charges when you finish a long rest. If you finish a long rest in extreme cold, the bow regains all expended charges.
You can cast the following spells from the bow, expending the necessary number of charges (save DC 17): hail of thorns (1 charge), sleet storm (3 charges), conjure volley (4 charges).

item.name: Harpoon Gun
entries: This crossbow made from carved driftwood and whalebone contains a single barbed bolt attached to it with a thick cable.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which does not require ammunition to fire.
Instead, the rope retracts the bolt back into your space, which allows you to load it normally.
When you hit a creature or object with this magic weapon, you can choose to stick the barbs of the bolt into the target.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, you can use a bonus action to retract the rope that extends between the two of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled 15 feet toward you. The target can use its action to make a Strength check to remove the bolt (DC 15), and takes 2d6 slashing damage on a success. Medium or smaller creatures other than you can climb or hang from the rope, which can hold up to 1,000 lbs.
Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to pull yourself 15 feet toward the target. This movement can carry you up vertical surfaces and through water or thin air.

item.name: Heat Compass
entries: More accurately called a gyroscope, this palm-sized sphere of blue-tinted glass contains two differently-colored needles suspended by near-invisible wires, and is held together by a band of smooth basalt carved with Gnomish runes. When you use an action to press the runes, the yellow needle points toward the largest source of heat in a 5-mile radius, while the red needle points towards the most concentrated source of heat in the area.

item.name: Iceberg Shield
entries: While wielding this shield made of white ice that never melts, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

While its weight is equal to a normal shield, this shield floats on the surface of water and other liquids. It has enough space to support one Medium creature on its surface, and can support up to 1,000 pounds before it sinks. If released from such a weight, it rises toward the surface of the water at a rate of 60 feet per round.

item.name: Inedible Rod
entries: The smooth surface of this foot-long steel rod is painfully cold to the touch. A blue button caps one end.

When a creature makes a melee attack against you or another target within your reach using its mouth (such as a dragon's bite or a froghemoths' tongue), you can use your reaction to intercept the attack with this rod and push the button on the end.
The rod becomes the target of the attack, which automatically hits, though the rod takes no damage. Instead, the creature takes 2d6 cold damage as it bites down on the freezing metal.

The rod expands or shrinks to fit the creature's jaws, which forces them to remain open. The surface of the rod also freezes to the creature's tongue (if it has one). So long as the rod remains in its mouth, the creature cannot speak or perform any attacks or actions that require the use of its mouth.
At the start of each of its turns, the creature can make a DC 18 Strength check to attempt to remove the rod. If it succeeds, it takes 2d6 slashing damage as it rips the inside of its mouth.
The rod then thaws and returns to its normal size.

item.name: Newfallen Snowboots
entries: These magically-treated custom baby-seal-leather boots are said to be some of the most comfortable winter footwear ever made.
While wearing these boots, you ignore all difficult terrain created by ice, snow, and slush, and you walk along the surface of snowdrifts and deep snow rather than sinking into it.

item.name: North Pole
entries: This moulded cylinder of smooth iron is always cold to the touch, and its far end has been painted bright red.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While holding the weapon, you can use a bonus action to fire a pulse of invisible energy that repels a creature or object that is not being worn or carried within 30 feet of you. The target must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you in a straight line.
The target has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is made of or wearing or carrying an object made of ferrous metal.

item.name: South Pole
entries: This moulded cylinder of smooth iron is always cold to the touch, and its far end has been painted bright red.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While holding the weapon, you can use a bonus action to fire a pulse of invisible energy that pulls a creature or object that is not being worn or carried within 30 feet of you. The target must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet towards you in a straight line.
The target has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is made of or wearing or carrying an object made of ferrous metal.

item.name: Snowglobe
entries: This frosted glass sphere drips cold water when held or exposed to heat. You can use an action to vigorously shake the globe and throw it to a point within 60 feet of you, where it shatters.
Snow and ice fog swirl in a 30-foot-radius, 15-foot-high cylinder centered on the point you threw it to, and the ground freezes in the same area.
The area is heavily obscured and becomes difficult terrain.

item.name: Staff of Antipodes
entries: If you attune to both the {@item North Pole|NorthernReaches} and {@item South Pole|NorthernReaches} clubs, the two combine into a single long cylinder of iron, which can be used as a quarterstaff. When the North Pole and the South Pole are combined into the Staff of Antipodes, you are considered to be attuned to one magic item, rather than two.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
You can use the bonus action granted by either pole when wielding this weapon, and the DC increases to 17.

item.name: Staff of Journeying
entries: This hiking staff carved from larch heartwood is enchanted to ease long journeys along frigid arctic paths.

While holding this staff, you can travel for 10 hours, instead of 8, before you must make saves against exhaustion, as described in the {@book Forced March|PHB|8|Travel Pace} rules. In addition, your speed increases by 5 feet when encumbered and you no longer suffer disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution savings throws inflicted by being encumbered.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the acrasian alpha can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Blizzard Blur
entries: The acrasian alpha has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in snowy terrain, and can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by falling snow, hail, and objects and structures covered in fallen snow or ice.

trait.name: Snow Tunneler
entries: When the acrasian alpha moves through snow, it has a burrow speed of 30 ft. It also ignores all difficult terrain created by snow and ice.

trait.name: Winter Tracker
entries: When in contact with fallen snow or ice, the acrasian alpha has {@sense tremorsense|mm} in a 60 ft. radius. This sense cannot penetrate materials other than snow and ice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acrasian alpha makes two claw attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a frost bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Frost Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Seize {@recharge 5}
entries: The acrasian alpha makes two claw attacks against the same target. If both attacks hit and the target is a Large or smaller creature, the acrasian alpha makes
one Frost Bite attack against the target, with advantage. If it hits, the target has disadvantage on its saving throw against {@condition exhaustion}.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The acrasian alpha orders one acrasian that it can see within 30 feet of it to move up to its speed and make one melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Hide
entries: The acrasian alpha moves up to 15 feet in any direction and makes a Dexterity (Stealth) check to to attempt to hide.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The acrasian alpha makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The acrasian ambusher has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Blizzard Blur
entries: The acrasian ambusher has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in snowy terrain, and can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by falling snow, hail, and objects and structures covered in fallen snow or ice.

trait.name: Snow Tunneler
entries: When the acrasian ambusher moves through snow, it has a burrow speed of 30 ft. It also ignores all difficult terrain created by snow and ice.

trait.name: Winter Tracker
entries: When in contact with fallen snow or ice, the acrasian ambusher has {@sense tremorsense|mm} in a 60 ft. radius. This sense cannot penetrate materials other than snow and ice.

action.name: Frost Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 ({@dice 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

trait.name: Blizzard Blur
entries: The acrasian hunter has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in snowy terrain, and can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by falling snow, hail, and objects and structures covered in fallen snow or ice.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The acrasian hunter has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the acrasian hunters' allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Snow Sprinter
entries: The acrasian hunter ignores difficult terrain created by snow and ice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acrasian hunter makes two claw attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ({@dice 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 {@dice 1d8} cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 5 ft. for 1 hour.

action.name: Frost Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 ({@dice 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15).

monster.name: Acrasian Witch
languages: one prey language (typically Common, Draconic, Giant, Sylvan, or Yeti)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acrasian witch's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blizzard Blur
entries: The acrasian witch has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in snowy terrain, and can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by falling snow, hail, and objects and structures covered in fallen snow or ice.

trait.name: Snow Shambler
entries: The acrasian witch ignores difficult terrain created by snow and ice.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ({@dice 2d6+3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@dice 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Solidify
entries: A patch of snow-covered ground freezes solid in a 15-foot radius centered on a point within 15 of the acrasian witch. Any creature in the area without resistance or immunity to cold damage must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

monster.name: Acrasian Zombie
languages: understands Common and Goblin but can't speak

trait.name: Blizzard Blur
entries: The acrasian zombie has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to {@action hide} in snowy terrain, and can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by falling snow, hail, and objects and structures covered in fallen snow or ice.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The acrasian zombie's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The acrasian zombie deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Snow Shambler
entries: The acrasian zombie ignores all difficult terrain created by snow and ice.

trait.name: Winter Tracker
entries: When in contact with fallen snow or ice, the acrasian zombie has {@sense tremorsense|mm} in a 60 ft. radius. This sense cannot penetrate materials other than snow and ice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acrasian zombie makes one icicle morningstar attack and uses its Ice Scythe Sweep, if available.

action.name: Icicle Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 ({@dice 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 9 {@dice 2d8} cold damage.

action.name: Ice Scythe Sweep {@recharge 6}
entries: The acrasian zombie sweeps its ice scythe in a 15-foot cone. Each creature and object in that area must make a {dc 20}  Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@dice 2d10}) slashing damage and 16 ({@dice 3d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While it is grappling a creature, the azure sorbet takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature {@condition grappled} by the azure sorbet takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the azure sorbet remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a patch of slick ice, unless an observer succeeds on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check.

trait.name: Liquid Form
entries: The sorbet can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The azure sorbet can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Tunneler (Purple Worm)
entries: The azure sorbet can burrow through solid iceat half its speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Watery Stealth
entries: While underwater, the sorbert has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sorbet makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage.

action.name: Smother Warmth
entries: One Huge or smaller creature that the sorbet can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, suffocates unless it can breathe in water, and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. The sorbet can only smother one creature at a time.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When the sorbet is subjected to cold or slashing damage, it splits into two azure sorbettos if it has at least 10 hit points. Each sorbetto has hit points equal to half the original sorbet's, rounded down.

Dormant during Summer thaws, these translucent blue oozes emerge to hunt beneath the frozen surfaces of lakes and rivers. Though ambush predators, sorbet are capable combatants if pressed. When outmatched, they split into two smaller sorbettoes; one stays behind to distract the threat, while the other flees to live another day and regain its lost size.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While it is grappling a creature, the azure sorbetot takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature {@condition grappled} by the azure sorbetto takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the azure sorbetto remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a patch of slick ice, unless an observer succeeds on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check.

trait.name: Liquid Form
entries: The sorbetto can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The azure sorbetto can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The azure sorbetto can burrow through solid iceat half its speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Watery Stealth
entries: While underwater, the sorbert has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

action.name: Smother Warmth
entries: One Large or smaller creature that the sorbetto can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, suffocates unless it can breathe in water, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. The sorbetto can only smother one creature at a time.

Dormant during Summer thaws, these translucent blue oozes emerge to hunt beneath the frozen surfaces of lakes and rivers. Though ambush predators, sorbet are capable combatants if pressed. When outmatched, they split into two smaller sorbettoes; one stays behind to distract the threat, while the other flees to live another day and regain its lost size.

monster.name: Blizzard of Ice Mephits
languages: Understands Aquan and Auran but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the blizzard of ice mephits dies, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Whiteout
entries: When a creature enters the blizzard's space for the first time or starts its turn there, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and is {@condition blinded} until it leaves the blizzard's space, which is heavily obscured.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The blizzard of ice mephits can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small elemental. The blizzard can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The blizzard of ice mephits deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blizzard makes four claw attacks, or two claw attacks if the blizzard has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 6d4 + 2}) cold damage.
Ice mephits, like their dust and steam relatives, are capricious creatures that gather in large groups in their preferred climates.
Severe ice storms whip the icy imps into a frenzy of hostile activity. The mephits whirl in a cloud of ice and snow as they rejoice in nature's expression of elemental chaos.

But all good things must come to an end. When the storm passes, the source of their rapture disappears. The joyous celebration curdles into frenzied rage, and the mephits lash out at anything they can find—and actively seek new targets.

The swarm whirls across the landscape, felling trees and flash-freezing its unfortunate victims as it passes. While the storm dissipates with time, the mephits leverage their knowledge of the surrounding area to seek out and destroy areas of civilization.

Survivors of these blizzard attacks emerge from snow-weighted shelters to find their homes blanketed with ice, their neighbors' homes torn apart by howling winds and icy claws, and their inhabitants frozen into statues of solid ice.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The chillerpillar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The chillerpillar ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: With the DM's permission, the find familiar spell can summon a chillerpillar.

trait.name: Little Larva
entries: The chillerpillar can enter another creature's space and stop there, regardless of the creature's size.

action.name: Nibble
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, plus 1 cold damage.

action.name: Crystal Cocoon
entries: The chillerpillar encases itself with icy silk and lowers itself on a silk strand up to 30 feet, where it dangles. Until it exits the cocoon as an action, it is {@condition restrained} and its AC increases to 18.

action.name: Crystal Strand
entries: The chillarpillar spins a strand of ice-cold silk and shoots toward an object it can see within 30 feet of it. The chillarpillar can climb along the silk at its normal speed, and the silk melts after 10 minutes. If a Small or larger creature moves through the silk, it breaks, and any creature climbing along the silk falls to the ground.

Some believe that a chillerpillar's dangling cocoon lies at the heart of every icicle. These tiny insects form surprisingly-durable shells made from strands of icy silk that they spin. These cocoons protect them from predators in their native habitats, where the temperature is almost always below freezing.

These strands begin to melt as soon as they leave the chillerpillar's body even in sub-freezing temperatures. Garments made from chillerpillar silk are priceless treasures in northern fey courts, who find the silk's transient nature fascinating. Powerful fey often use
the fast-melting garments as an ostentatious symbol of wealth.

Many hunters in the frozen wilds learn to recognize their dangling cocoons as a sign that the barriers between the Material planes and Feywild have grown dangerously thin. Chillerpillars have no aversion to areas steeped in enchanting magic, for their feelers are perfectly designed to detect illusions upon contact. They take advantage of this sense to congregate in pockets invisible to other predators.

Thanks to their cute appearance, long life, and ease of care (chillerpillars have voracious appetites, but can subsist entirely on ice, snow, and chilled water), children in arctic regions often capture them and collect them as pets.
In some areas, these tiny insects are called "caterchillars."

monster.name: Flying Reindeer
languages: and Gnomish but can't speak them

trait.name: Charge (Wereboar)
entries: If the flying reindeer moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@dice 2d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The flying reindeer counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Workhorse
entries: The flying reindeer has advantage on Constitution saving throws against {@condition exhaustion} inflicted by a forced march or long hours of labor.

trait.name: Variant: Shining Nose
entries: Any particular flying reindeer has a ⅛ chance to know the {@spell light} cantrip. It can only cast the spell targeting its own nose, and the light can only be colored red. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability for this spell.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the living glacier dies, it crumbles into a cloud of ice crystals, lightly obscuring its space. {@dice 3d6} {@creature blizzard of ice mephits|NorthernReachs|blizzards of ice mephits} emerge from the cloud at the start of its next turn. These blizzards act on their own initiative count.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The living glacier's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The living glacier deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Arctic Aura
entries: Any creature that touches the living glacier, hits it with a melee attack while within 30 feet of it, or starts its turn within 60 feet of it takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the living glacier fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Glacial Advance
entries: The living glacier can move through objects and structures of any kind as if they were difficult terrain. The first time it comes into contact with an object or structure, the target takes 150 bludgeoning damage. Ground the living glacier moves through becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: The living glacier makes one regelation stomp attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The living glacier makes a Perception check.

legendary.name: Glacial Surge
entries: The living glacier moves up to twice its speed.

legendary.name: Cold Breath
entries: The living glacier uses its ice beam action.

legendary.name: Refreeze
entries: The living glacier recharges its ice beam action.

legendary.name: Regrowth (costs 3 actions)
entries: The living glacier regains 143 ({@dice 7d20 + 70}) hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living glacier makes two stomp attacks.

action.name: Regelation Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.each 20 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. Each creature standing on the ground in a 120-foot radius centered on the living glacier must make a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature within 10 feet of the target is knocked {@condition prone} in this way, it is {@condition restrained} until the living glacier moves at least 30 feet or makes another regelation stomp attack against one creature {@condition restrained} in this way.

action.name: Ice Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The living glacier fires a beam of freezing magic in a line 30 feet wide and 300 feet long. Each creature and object within that area must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If this damage kills a creature it becomes a frozen statue until thaws.

trait.name: Ice Flow
entries: The living iceberg has a swim speed of 40 feet. If it ends a turn under the surface of the water, it rises toward the surface if nothing else is holding it under.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the living iceberg fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Glacial Surge
entries: The first time on a turn the living iceberg swims at least 10 feet in a straight line, all swimming creatures and floating objects within 30 feet of the living iceberg are pushed 10 feet away from it.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The living iceberg's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The living iceberg deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Calving
entries: When the living iceberg is reduced to half its hit points or less, its size is reduced to Large and its swim speed increases to 60 feet. It also gains access to the Dive legendary action.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the living iceberg moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is an object or structure submerged in or floating upon the surface of the water, the attack deals maximum damage to it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living iceberg makes two stomp attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Impact Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The living iceberg rises in the water and slams onto the surface, sending waves through the water in a 60-foot radius around it. Each creature and object within that area must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. A target takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage and is hurled 30 into the air, taking falling damage as appropriate when it lands. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not thrown. The living iceberg cannot use this feature on land.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The living iceberg makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The living iceberg makes a Perception check.

legendary.name: Dive (costs 2 actions)
entries: The living iceberg swims up to twice its speed.

legendary.name: Impact Wave (costs 3 actions)
entries: The living iceberg uses its impact wave action, even if it has not recharged.

The smaller, lighter, and much faster aquatic children of living glaciers, living icebergs form when a piece of magical ice falls from the body of a living glacier and lands in ocean water. While cripplingly slow on land, living icebergs are deceptively fast in water, though their natural buoyancy keeps them afloat unless sufficiently roused to anger.

Unlike their placid parents, living icebergs are territorial creatures. They plague northern shipping routes, but since living icebergs are as aggressive with one another as they are with foreign bodies in their waters, they are not threats for long.

When damaged, the outer layers of a living iceberg slough off to reveal a core of even greater speed and aggression. The smaller weight allows the living iceberg to dive beneath the surface for brief periods; whether to escape or attack is left to the individual iceberg's disposition.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the giant moose moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure Footed
entries: The giant moose has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the narwhal moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath (Killer Whale)
entries: The narwhal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Slide
entries: If the penguin takes the Dash action on an icy surface, then it has a speed of 30 feet rather than 5 (allowing it to move a total of 60 feet until the end of its turn).

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The penguin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

spell.name: Aurora Wall
entries: A writhing wall of translucent multicolored light appears at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free-floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. Creatures and objects can see and pass through the wall normally, which emits dim light in a 300-foot radius.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 4d10} damage, or half as much on damage on a successful save.
A creature that ends it turn in the wall's area takes {@dice 4d10} damage.
When a creature takes damage from this spell, roll a {@dice d6} to determine which type of damage it takes.

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: Massive chunks of ice, rock, and snow tumble to the ground from the top of a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage and {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 18 Strength (Athletics) check to escape.

The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble within the avalanche and the temperature outside it. Any ground within the cylinder becomes difficult terrain after the spell ends.
Any structure caught within the area takes 50 points of bludgeoning damage, and if destroyed, is reduced to rubble and tumbles down the cylinder with the snow and ice.
If you cast this spell and orient the height of the cylinder to be parallel to an existing hillside, mountain, or other natural slope, the spell's bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 3d6}.

m.text: a horn made of red pine inlaid with brass worth at least 5 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the cold and bludgeoning damage both increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Conjure Snowman
entries: Snow swirls to life at a point you choose within range, transforming into a snow golem with the material components used to cast this spell arranged into crude facial features.
The golem is friendly to you and your companions for the
duration. Roll initiative for the golem, which acts on its own turns.
It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action
required). If you don't any issue any commands, it defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions.
When the spell ends, the golem melts into a puddle of tepid
water and dies. The DM has the snow golem's statistics, which can be found in Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden.

m.text: (a snowball, a fistful of coal, a root vegetable, and a cloth hat worth at least 1 gp

spell.name: Freezer Burn
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, you charge the target's body with cold that overwhelms the senses. The target takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage. This fire damage ignores resistance and immunity to fire damage, and is instead affected by resistance and immunity to cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Frozen Flesh
entries: mpossible cold oozes from your fingertips, freezing the flesh of a creature you touch and turning it brittle. During the spell's duration, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack, dealing {@damage 2d10} cold damage to a target on a hit. You can no longer make this melee spell attack; instead, the target's flesh is glassy and fragile until the spell ends, making it vulnerable to bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Galvanice Spikes
entries: Choose five points within range, each on a solid surface. A conical spike of ice charged with electricity 1 foot wide at the base and 5 feet tall rises from each point.

When the spikes appear, creatures within 5 feet of each point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage. A creature within 5 feet of multiple spikes is affected only once.

Until the spell ends, you can use your bonus action to link any two ice spikes created by this spell with an arc of lightning, which spreads from one spike to another in a line 5 feet wide. Any creature in the line when the lightning appears or that ends its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.
Each time you form a new lightning bolt, the previous one fizzles out harmlessly.

components.m: a steel rod with a disc at one end and copper wire coiled tightly around the shaft, frozen in ice

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can create and maintain one additional arc of lightning for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Gangrene
entries: You charge your hand with subzero energy. During the spell's duration, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack, dealing {@damage 4d6} cold damage on a hit.

You can no longer make this melee spell attack; instead, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and is unable to properly use one limb or appendage of your choice for {@dice 1d4} hours. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the spell ends.

The debilitation the target suffers depends on the limb you choose to touch when you make the melee spell attack. For example, a gangrenous leg reduces the target's walking speed by half, and a gangrenous arm or hand cannot wield weapons or perform the somatic components of spells.

entries.name: Arm/Hand
entries: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that use or rely on that hand.

entries.name: Foot/leg
entries: The target's walking speed is reduced by 10 feet, and opportunity attacks made against it while it is walking (rather than flying or swimming) are made with advantage.

entries.name: Neck
entries: Whenever the target attempts to speak, it must succeed on a Constitution check against your spell save DC.

entries.name: Wing
entries: If the target has a flying speed and flies during its turn, it falls if ends its turn in the air and nothing else is holding it aloft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both the cold damage and necrotic damage increase by {@dice 1d6}, and the number of hours the target's limb is frozen increases by {@dice 1d4} hours, for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ice Rink
entries: You coat a solid surface in a 20-foot-radius circle centered on a point within range with slippery, mirror-smooth ice.

If you froze a lateral surface, such as a floor, any creature that moves onto or within the surface must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target loses its footing and slides to the far end of the area in the direction it moved. It continues to slide until it reaches the opposite side of the area or collides with another creature or object within it (even if it runs out of movement).

If you froze a vertical surface, such as a wall or a cliffside, any creature that enters the frozen area or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it slides to the bottom of the area, though it catches itself once it reaches an unfrozen surface (if any).
In either case, an affected creature expends 1 foot of movement for every foot it slides along the frozen surface. Sliding across the ice doesn't trigger opportunity attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's radius increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Layers
entries: You touch a willing creature and inure it against extreme temperatures. Until the spell ends, the target takes on a rotund appearance, and has resistance to cold and fire damage.
While affected by this spell, a creature stores enough energy that it does not need to eat that day, even after the spell ends.

components.m: a pound of lard or a swatch of fur

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mudflat
entries: You saturate the earth beneath your feet with groundwater, transforming solid soil into a rippling, watery surface. Creatures of your choice can walk upon the surface without issue. Otherwise, when a creature enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or sink up to one-third of its height into the mud, where it is {@condition grappled}.

If a creature with one-third of its height already sunk into the mud makes an attack roll or ability check using Strength or Dexterity, it sinks up to two-thirds of its height and is both {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. If it does so again, it becomes fully submerged in the mud and begins suffocating.
A {@condition grappled} creature can use its action to slowly and safely extract itself from the mud.
When the spell ends, any creatures and objects that have sunk any distance into the mud are harmlessly ejected into the nearest unoccupied space.
Any area of solid ground within the spell's area, such as stone, wood, or tile, is unaffected by this spell and remains safe.

spell.name: Muffle
entries: A cloud of pillowy snowflakes fall in the air around you, muffling sounds within the spell's area. For the duration, all creatures within range have resistance to thunder and falling damage, and the audible distance of sound made within the area is halved.

spell.name: Needle Ice
entries: The temperature in a 20-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range plunges below zero and forms hard stalagmites of ice at painful angles. Non-magical liquids in the area freeze solid. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creatures moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 3d4} cold damage for every 5 feet it travels.

Any metal objects within the area suffer from the drop in temperature, and become painful to touch. Any creature in physical contact with a metal object takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage when you cast this spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to deal this damage again through one metal object you can see.
If a creature separates itself or is separated from a metal object affected by this spell, it takes {@damage 3d8} slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 6th level or higher, the cold damage inflicted by contact with a metal object increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Permafrost
entries: This spell channels bitter, long-lasting cold into soil within a specific area. There are two possible uses for this spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become brittle and frozen, and the ground becomes slippery. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.
You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you freeze the soil. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range freeze and cannot grow or be harvested for 1 year. The plants yield no food and crumble to shards when touched.

spell.name: Refractal

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range takes radiant damage, is hit by a ranged spell attack, or makes a Dexterity saving throw

entries: A multifaceted barrier of reflective, translucent ice crystals forms between the trigger and the target creature.

Roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1, the target is unaffected by the ranged spell attack or Dexterity saving throw, and the effect is reflected back at its origin point as though it originated from the target (though other targets affected by an effect that requires a Dexterity saving throw are still affected as normal). On a roll of 2 or higher, the target gains the benefits of three-quarters cover for the triggering spell attack or saving throw.
Regardless of the roll's result, any effect that deals radiant damage is automatically reflected back towards its point of origin as described above.

m.text: (a glass prism with the shape of a snowflake frosted onto its surface worth at least 100 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 5th level, roll {@dice 1d12} instead of {@dice 1d20}. At 6th level, {@dice 1d10}, at 7th level, {@dice 1d8}, at 8th level, {@dice 1d6}, and at 9th level, {@dice 1d4}.

spell.name: Refrigerate
entries: You touch a perishable item, such as a piece of raw meat, a fruit, or an organ cut from a monster, and lower it to temperatures below freezing and extend the amount of time it remains fresh.
If the item would spoil in 1 hour, it instead spoils in 1 day; if it would spoil after 1 day, it instead spoils after 1 week; and if it would spoil in 1 week it instead spoils after 1 month.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 5th level or higher, its casting time increases to 1 hour, and the target item remains fresh indefinitely.

spell.name: Stygian Plunge
entries: You sweep your hand in a wide arc and draw all warmth before you into the frozen rivers of the Nine Hells. Non-magical liquids in the area freeze solid. Each creature in the area takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition restrained} as fluid in its body begins to freeze and heavy ice weighs down its limbs. A creature partially or entirely submerged in the water is trapped within the ice, automatically fails the initial Constitution saving throw, and takes maximum damage from the spell.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell 3 times, the spell ends for it. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to unmelting ice and subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition until the effect is removed. The successes and failures don't have to be consecutive; keep track of both until a target collects three of a kind.
If a creature is broken while {@condition petrified}, it suffers from similar deformities if it returns to its original state.

m.text: the eye of an ice devil, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Taezlin's Soporific Sphere
entries: Channeling the cold of long winter nights, you manifest a 10-foot-radius sphere of bleak magical darkness centered on a point you can see within range. The darkness spreads around corners.

When the sphere appears, each creature in its area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it feels a comforting warmth encircle it and it falls {@condition unconscious}. A target remains {@condition unconscious} until it takes damage, is moved out of the sphere, or the spell ends.
A creature that ends its turn within the sphere must also make a Wisdom saving throw or be knocked {@condition unconscious}.
In addition, the speed of any creature that starts its turn in the sphere is reduced by 10 feet until the start of its next turn.

components.m: a square from a quilted blanket

spell.name: Wall of Snow
entries: You pack dense, wet snow into a barrier in a location you can see within range. The area of the spell consists of up to 5 five-foot cubes, which you can arrange however you wish. The face of each cube must be adjacent to the face of at least one other cube. Each 5-foot cube is an object with AC 8, 15 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and vulnerability to fire damage. When a 5-foot cube of snow is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses, and might cause other cubes that it supported to fall into its vacant space, if those cubes aren't supported by at least one other stable cube.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create two additional 5-foot cubes for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Whiteout
entries: Until the spell ends, drifts of bright, powdery snow accumulate in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range, reflecting all light. Bright light fills the area, and objects and creatures within it cannot cast a shadow.

When a creature enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition blinded} until the spell ends or it leaves the affected area.

components.m: a pinch of white powder and a pair of glasses with tinted lenses

spell.name: Windchill
entries: A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts toward you from a point you can see within range. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Whether each target succeeds or fails, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half the total damage dealt to all targets.
